page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Unemployment is less noticeable here than in the cities. There are only two men unemployed. Most people are engaged in{agriculture}- farmers are self-employed, male workers are employed full-time. {Women}work part-time during seasons, picking flowers, harvesting bulbs and potatoes, berry-picking, roguing grain, clearing stones from fields,and one or two women look after the calves on the dairy farms. The fish factory in Inverbervie employs several of our women and girls. Some people{travel}as far as Dyce, Aberdeen to work, and at least one man works off-shore. There are a few{pensioners,}all active, and most working much as before retirement. Local{children}of thirteen and over help with seasonal work during school holidays.
